name: Add Route
description: Connect the selected computer to a random nearby node when possible (does not leave logs).

name: Agent Scum
description: Even though you are neutral, doxx attempts will show you as an Agent. Upon your death, the original Operation Leader identity will be revealed to AGENTs.

name: All In
description: Becomes the field agent. (permanentely lose all AGENT LEADER skills - can be used only if the original field agent is out of play)

name: Alter Logs
description: Physically access and tamper the log files of a target machine. (Immune to Denial of Service)

name: Arrest
description: Attempt arresting the target. Your cover won't be blown in case of failure, as you will direct the operation from an undercover van (except by nosy journalists).

name: Ask The Right Question
description: Visit someone tonight to discuss the hack in person. Learn if that person has a legitimate 'Hack Target' skill.

name: Bait Law Enforcement
description: Send an anoymous tip to agents about your target being a NETSEC member. Hopefully they will think a bounty hunter did it...

name: Blackmailed Informer
description: The informer that is helping AGENTs will relay to you his intel (if the Agent Leader asks for it). It will also try to bribe an AGENT Detective...

name: Covert Broadcast
description: You hold root access of the NETSEC operation: you can anonimously message everyone.

name: Install CCTV Surveillance
description: Install a CCTV system at the subject location. Allows for CCTV surveillance as long as the target is alive and does not move hideout (Visits the target).

name: Perform CCTV Surveillance
description: keep tabs on a person tonight. You will know if he/she has been visited tonight (Requires installation of CCTV first)

name: Citizen's Arrest
description: Attempt to arrest your target. Years in the force allows you to follow their protocol seamlessly: your cover will stay safe if you fail, except from journalists.

name: Computer forensics background
description: You don't know everything: you know enough for the job. (Assigns a random skill between Unskilled Attack, Hack, Denial of Service)

name: Cover Checks Out
description: Your cover will hold for the first three days, in the event of doxxing or death. (Appear as a netsec class to non-agents)

name: Cover Your Tracks
description: If they can’t find you, they can’t arrest you, right? You take extra precautions tonight, giving you a high chance to avoid an arrest tonight.

name: Crack Credentials
description: The Operation Leader is dead - you can attempt to crack his credentials to assume his identity...if root was not transferred safely.

name: Create Hideout
description: Create a new hideout for you to escape to. Better safe than sorry, right? (Adds 1 charge to 'Move Hideout')

name: Denial of Service
description: Temporary disable the node by flooding it with traffic (Cannot be prevented by any other skill.)

name: Desperate Measures
description: Desperate times require desperate measures. Become an Improvised Hacker (usable from Day 4).

name: Disorganized Murder
description: Try murdering your target. You know it will be messy. (Available from Night 4)

name: Diversion
description: You are ready to act as a diversion when escorting someone (you will be arrested instead of your target).

name: Download Intel
description: Search for important personal data on a hacked machine. If successful, we will either gain more time for the hack, learn the IP address of the target, or gain important information about our crew.

name: Doxx and stalk
description: By doxxing and stalking the target, you will gain intel about the target (Learn the faction of the target player)

name: Dumpster Dive
description: Check the dumpsters and trash bins for important information. (Decreases difficulty of a random node when successful)

name: Emergency Extraction
description: Send a hired team to move a member to a safe hideout.

name: Escort
description: Escort the target operative to a new hideout, protecting from arrest attempts and murder attempts. Retaliate from murder attempts.

name: Expose Operation Leader
description: The TV crew owes you one: send them and expose the target as Operation Leader (gain an instant article, if correct)

name: Follow
description: Follow the target and learn who he/she will visit tonight.

name: Frame
description: Visit and frame the target player, so that it will appear as random NETSEC class if arrested or killed (framed status lasts the whole match)

name: Get Bribe
description: Someone is willing to pay for information. And you will gladly sell your services (gain extra xp/coins at the end of the game, if a winner).

name: Grant root Access
description: Grant root access to the whole operation to a specific member. If you die or get arrested, that user will become the new OP Leader.

name: Hack Target
description: Try pwning the machine (targets node, leaves log). The more people try hacking the same node, the more likely the capture.

name: Harden Node
description: Apply security patches and stop unnecessary services to make the hack harder.

name: Impartial Sabotage
description: Your ethics have been..questionable. Get a scoop by creating some drama, sabotaging this node (Rollbacks, leaves connection log and fake logs).

name: Impersonate
description: Impersonate your target by spoofing all your outbound emails tonight. (Send emails using your target as sender)

name: Insider Knowledge
description: Snoop around the office and learn the IP address of a valuable secondary target.

name: Intelligence Informer
description: Use an undercover contact to obtain information about the target (Learn the target faction and class type)

name: Interrogate
description: Sit down with your target for a...talk. Tomorrow, you will be able to read their personal log (as of tonight)

name: Probe Node
description: Investigate potential ways to takeover the target node. (Makes the node easier to hack into)

name: ISP Isolation
description: Use a warrant to force the ISP to disconnect the target operative from the internet for today. (prevents network connections)

name: Jam Network
description: Use a jammer to temporarily block all outbound connections from the target operative.

name: Get Scoop
description: Covertly ask the right questions that will allow you to write an article later.

name: Write Article
description: Write an article about the hack. (You need to get a scoop from a non-neutral player first)

name: Plant Keylogger
description: Plant USB keyloggers in the organization. Can be recovered during the night.

name: Retrieve Keylogger
description: Retrieve keylogger data, slightly increasing all our attack chances tomorrow.

name: Log Analysis
description: Cross reference network logs to find suspicious data streams. (clear access log from tampered entries)

name: Looking for an old friend
description: You remember the traitor face very well. Lets get to work. (Lets you know if the target is the original OP leader)

name: Midnight Meeting
description: Meet with a target player tonight to discuss important matters. (Occupies player, visits the target)

name: Misdirection
description: Occupy everyone that visits you tonight.

name: Move Hideout
description: Move to a safer hideout, making you safe from arrest, murder and deals attempts.

name: Not a Snitch
description: You will never accept a plea deal - you'd rather go to jail.

name: No Dirt on Me
description: You infiltrated NETSEC via questionable connections, but didn't actually commit any crime. AGENTS have no power on you (conversion immune, arrest immune unless framed)

name: Planned Raid
description: Pose as a NETSEC enforcer and escort the target to an AGENT controlled 'safehouse' - the target will be arrested by the local police 24 hours later, not exposing you.

name: Plant Fake Information
description: Print and throw in the trash fake login information. (Prevents success of Dumpster Diving success for tonight)

name: Prepared for Anything
description: Law enforcement can search for you as much as they want: they don't know about your hideouts. (Move Hideout has two additional charges)

name: Review Connection Logs
description: Review today's connection logs to find out if the target's connection was cut off.

name: Rollback
description: Secure back a pwned target machine, as best as you can, adding fake logs in the process.

name: Script Kiddie Attack
description: Try hacking the target by using a well known and outlived exploit from a public database. VERY unlikely to succeed.

name: Search for Keyloggers
description: Search for keyloggers at the target's building, and destroy them.

name: Throw under the bus
description: Something doesn't feel right: better to have someone else take the fall tonight. (redirect self to target player)

name: Setup
description: Trick your target into visiting someone else tonight (your target will be occupied)

name: Snitch To Cops
description: You have enough proof to have regular cops make an arrest. Lets make it count...

name: Murder
description: Visit and murder your target. If your victim is the operation leader, proceed with identity theft. Make it count.

name: Spearphishing Execution
description: Spoof and email the website link to potential targets, tricking them into revealing their credentials (makes target node easier to hack)

name: Spearphishing Preparation
description: Carefully craft a trap website. You will later use this to obtain stolen credentials. (Grants 1x Spearphish Execution)

name: Spill the Beans
description: Let AGENTs know who you think is a NETSEC member. If arrested within 48h, you will get a bounty.

name: Exploit vulnerability
description: Use a vulnerability exploit on the target machine (Makes capturing this node a lot easier).

name: Steal Intel
description: Find anything useful at the AGENT's HQ for your employer. Once found, you can then upload it, and consider your contract done.

name: Sting
description: Setup a sting, one time, operation. The target and everyone who visits him/her tonight will be arrested.

name: Strike Deal
description: Coerce a NETSEC member to flip to your side, in exchange for a pardon. (1 less available use for <= 12 players game, does not deplete on failure)

name: Target Knowledge
description: You can piece togheter scraps of information overheard at the office - if you own a computer directly connected to the target, you will know it.

name: Topology Knowledge
description: You have unrestricted access to the physical network, thus know everything about the network topology.

name: Unsecured Device
description: Agents will be able to recover -usually important- information about other operatives upon your arrest.

name: Unskilled Attack
description: Use some script kiddie tools downloaded from the web. They won't work, but logs will show your connections to the target machine.

name: Unstable Mind
description: It's easy getting information from you. If you are arrested, AGENTs gain 1 extra STING charge.

name: Upload Intel
description: Upload the stolen intel to the target node.

name: Wipe
description: Wipe all content from this node: this includes all connections logs and potential intel.

name: Wire Shark
description: Sniff all network traffic, discovering eventually who is executing a denial of service attack.

name: Wiretap
description: Wiretap the suspected hideout of the target, allowing you to read all the target's incoming and outgoing messages for the next 24 hours.

name: 0-Day Exploit
description: You have been saving this 0-day exploit for a special occasion. This is likely it. Try not to waste it. (100% chance to capture a node)
